meanings.definition: A horizontal bar with handgrips at each end, used to steer a bicycle.
meanings.sent1: I held onto the handlebars tightly while riding my bike.
meanings.sent2: The handlebars of the bicycle were shiny and new.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to steer the bicycle using the handlebars, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like handlebars, guiding her through the twists and turns of life.
meanings.sent5: The handlebars rattled as she sped down the hill, creating a symphony of adventure.

meanings.definition: A bar or rod attached to the front of a vehicle for steering.
meanings.sent1: The truck driver gripped the handlebars firmly to navigate the narrow street.
meanings.sent2: The handlebars on the ATV were adjustable for different riders.
meanings.sent3: The handlebars on the lawnmower made it look like a futuristic spaceship.
meanings.sent4: His words were like the handlebars of truth, guiding us in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The handlebars on the scooter were decorated with colorful streamers, adding a touch of whimsy.
